title_sort: walt whitman to rand & avery, 19 may 1882
title: Walt Whitman to Rand & Avery, 19 May 1882
text: 431 Stevens StreetCamden New JerseyMay 19 '82Dear SirsI suppose Benj:Benjamin Ticknor has informed you that the Osgood & Co: plates of Leaves of Grass now in your charge have been transferred to me, & are henceforth subject to my order.Will you please prepare for me for casting a new title page, the copy for which is herewith enclosed—As it is a small job, could you make up (I should say in the same long primer as book, but I leave it to Mr Clark's taste), & send the proof of it to me by next Monday night's mail—as I am waiting for new titles for 225 copies I have in sheets, & have an order for—Will return proof immediately with word how many I want printed.Walt WhitmanIf convenient please place this matter in the hands of H H Clark to whom I hereby send best remembrances & respects—W W Walt Whitman to Rand & Avery, 19 May 1882
